NAME.Nominative: Holy Martyrs Bishop Acepsimas, Presbyter Joseph and Deacon Aithalas

SAINT.LIFE: They suffered for Christ in Persia during the reign of Shapur II in the Fourth Century. St. Acepsimas was Bishop of Naasson where he zealously worked for the spread of the Christian faith. During the persecution, he was seized together with Presbyter Joseph and Deacon Aithalas. He underwent cruel beatings and for three years languished in prison. After this they beheaded him. Sts. Joseph and Aithalas were stoned to death. St. Aithalas is also commemorated on September 1.
